intro: Reichardia orientalis var. crispatula, commonly known as the curly leaf dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy, and often curled leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
